Description: Meroitic cup in eggshell ware with straight-sided walls, angular shoulder and flat base. Wheelmade from a kaolinite clay covered in a cream slip. The main part of the body is defined by two brown painted lines demarcating a band, within which a pattern of upright leaves was painted in brown and filled with red paint.
Bibliographic references: Adams 1986 / Ceramic Industries of Medieval Nubia, Part I, Part II (Figure 19.) (Type A16)
